Leaders of international Gen Z movement reflect on their countries' political futures
Subhead: From Nepal to Madagascar and Peru, youth-led revolts driven by socio-economic demands have shaken governments. But their horizontal mobilization strategy, born of digital culture, now hampers the political outcomes of these movements.

Kyiv is under 'massive' attack, says mayor
Subhead: Russia has intensified its attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities and rail systems. Early on Friday morning, almost every district in Kyiv was under 'massive' attack, with explosions reported in the city center. At least 11 people have been wounded.

Title: Uyghurs are no longer welcome in Turkey
Subhead: As Turkey strengthens ties with China, the Turkish government has shifted its migration policy toward members of the Muslim minority from Xinjiang – a community it once historically protected. Expulsions of Uyghurs are on the rise, as revealed by a Human Rights Watch investigation.

Title: France qualify for 2026 World Cup after defeating Ukraine 4-0
Subhead: Ahead of kick-off, a moment of silence was observed at Parc des Princes stadium in Paris  by the 41,000 spectators as France marked the 10th anniversary of the attacks in and around Paris on November 13, 2015.

Title: The relentless spiral of speed watching: 'If I don't set it to at least 1.5×, I get bored'
Subhead: From TikTok to YouTube, more and more young people are watching videos at increased speeds to consume more content in less time.

'Delhi is no longer livable': Deadly pollution in Indian capital claims more than 17,000 lives each year
Subhead: Millions of firecrackers set off during the Hindu festival of Diwali at the end of October have worsened the already extreme fine particle pollution engulfing the megacity. Every winter, Delhi's 30 million residents face a toxic nightmare, while blistering heat waves strike the city each summer.
